intro: Allophylus largifolius, commonly known as the large-leaf allophe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by red, fleshy fruits. Allophylus largifolius is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
